      • balanceVoxels

        static void balanceVoxels(java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxelsA,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxelsB,
                          PottsLocation location,
                          ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Balances voxels in the splits.

        Checks that the number of voxels in each split are within a certain difference. If not, then add voxels from the larger split into the smaller split such that both splits are still connected. For small split sizes, there may not be a valid split that is both connected and within the difference; in these cases, connectedness is prioritized and the splits are returned not balanced.

        Parameters:
        voxelsA - the list for the first half of the split
        voxelsB - the list for the second half of the split
        random - the seeded random number generator

      • calculateSurface

        abstract int calculateSurface()
        Calculates surface of location.
        Returns:
        the surface

      • checkVoxels

        static java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> checkVoxels(java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxels,
                                                       PottsLocation location,
                                                       ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random,
                                                       boolean update)
        Checks voxels in the list for connectedness.

        All the connected voxels from a random starting voxel are found and marked as visited. If there are no remaining unvisited voxels, then the list is fully connected. If there are, then the smaller of the visited or unvisited lists is returned.

        Some voxel lists may have more than one unconnected section.

        Parameters:
        voxels - the list of voxels
        random - the seeded random number generator
        update - true if the voxel list should be updated, false otherwise
        Returns:
        a list of unconnected voxels, null if the list is connected

      • connectVoxels

        static void connectVoxels(java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxelsA,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxelsB,
                          PottsLocation location,
                          ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Connects voxels in the splits.

        Checks that the voxels in each split are connected. If not, then move the unconnected voxels into the other split.

        Parameters:
        voxelsA - the list for the first half of the split
        voxelsB - the list for the second half of the split
        random - the seeded random number generator

      • split

        public Location split(ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Splits the location voxels into two lists.

        The location are split along the direction with the shortest diameter. The lists of locations are guaranteed to be connected, and generally will be balanced in size. One of the splits is assigned to the current location and the other is returned.

        Specified by:
        split in interface Location
        Parameters:
        random - the seeded random number generator
        Returns:
        a location with the split voxels

      • splitVoxels

        static void splitVoxels(Location.Direction direction,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxels,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxelsA,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Location.Voxel> voxelsB,
                        Location.Voxel center,
                        ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random)
        Splits the voxels in the location along a given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the slice
        voxelsA - the container list for the first half of the split
        voxelsB - the container list for the second half of the split
        random - the seeded random number generator
